definition: The word "dicht" refers to the state or quality of being tightly packed or closely spaced together. It is commonly used to describe objects or substances that are dense, compact, or closely arranged. This term can also be used metaphorically to describe a close-knit group or a strong bond between individuals.

examples.english: The friends are standing close together.

examples.german: Der Text ist sehr dicht geschrieben.
examples.english: The text is written very densely.

examples.german: Die Wolken hängen dicht über den Bergen.
examples.english: The clouds are hanging low over the mountains.

examples.german: Die Straße ist wegen Bauarbeiten dicht.
examples.english: The road is closed due to construction work.
